prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples,"Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(PCAtools)
library(ggplot2)

# Read count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Read annotation data
annotation_data <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = TRUE)

# Transpose count table
count_table <- count_table %>%
  t() %>%
  as.data.frame()

# Set row names as gene names
rownames(count_table) <- count_table$gene_names
count_table$gene_names <- NULL

# Remove any rows with missing values
count_table <- count_table[complete.cases(count_table), ]

# Join count table with annotation data
joined_data <- count_table %>% 
  left_join(annotation_data, by = c(colnames(count_table)))

# Perform statistical test for each group
group_specific_genes <- joined_data %>% 
  group_by(group) %>% 
  filter(n() > 1) %>% 
  summarise_all(function(x) wilcox.test(x ~ group)$p.value) %>% 
  filter(across(-group, ~. < 0.05)) %>% 
  select(group, contains("ENSG"))

# Filter count table based on group-specific genes
filtered_count_table <- count_table[, intersect(group_specific_genes$gene_names, colnames(count_table))]

# Perform PCA on filtered count table
pca <- pca(filtered_count_table)

# Plot PCA with color-coded groups
autoplot(pca, color = joined_data$group)
```
